the gameplay is legendary, the graphics are a big jump from games like portal 1 and half-life 2, despite being made in the same exact engine and designed with the same exact tool- source and Hammer.

not only that--- the soundtrack is absolutely, unbelievably, godly. this game is recommended as long as you play portal 1. you should definitely listen to the soundtrack after beating the game. i love the ones like Science is Fun, The Friendly Faith Plate, Bombs For Throwing At You, and so much more. if you don't play this after portal 1 yet still have it installed, sitting alone on your computer, you will be murdered in your sleep by- you guessed it- me.

Here we are, 12 years later, and games have regressed. Graphics / physics engines have gotten (a little) better, but that's it. Everything that makes an actual gaming experience like Portal 2, left and never returned. Passion has been removed from modern day gaming in all but a few titles. I got a PC to play these older games, from one of the best times in gaming history, to take a break from the literal trash that so many gaming companies produce today. Upon being reminded what real games are, I pray that gaming can someday return to what it used to be.
The best game of all time I would say - it is not just a game, it is a class for it's own!

Love the game

Ok. Ive already praised game 1 and game 2 is STILL better. The sequel did not dissapoint in any way.

The game is perfect in my opinion. The best part of game 1 has been kept the same which is the gameplay only that every other aspect of the game has improved, and by a lot. The story is amazing and even has some nice puns in it. The 2 main plot twists are well made and came as a bit of a surprise.

Gameplay as in game 1 is amazing. Nothing else to add.

The multiplayer part of this game has really given me a nice time in this game. Hunting times in different chanmbers with your friends is a reallyfun thing to do and the addition of the workshop chamber gives the game a lot of time you for you to spend in it.

Amazing 10/10.

If you dont have it get it now or you will forever be cursed to step on sharp lega bricks.
Definitely play the first Portal before this otherwise you may lack a sense of what the heck is going on.

Connection terminated. I'm sorry to interrupt you, Elizabeth, if you still even remember that name, But I'm afraid you've been misinformed. You are not here to receive a gift, nor have you been called here by the individual you assume, although, you have indeed been called. You have all been called here, into a labyrinth of sounds and smells, misdirection and misfortune. A labyrinth with no exit, a maze with no prize. You don't even realize that you are trapped. Your lust for blood has driven you in endless circles, chasing the cries of children in some unseen chamber, always seeming so near, yet somehow out of reach, but you will never find them. None of you will. This is where your story ends.

And to you, my brave volunteer, who somehow found this job listing not intended for you, although there was a way out planned for you, I have a feeling that's not what you want. I have a feeling that you are right where you want to be. I am remaining as well. I am nearby. This place will not be remembered, and the memory of everything that started this can finally begin to fade away. As the agony of every tragedy should.

And to you monsters trapped in the corridors, be still and give up your spirits They don't belong to you For most of you I believe there is peace and perhaps more waiting for you after the smoke clears Although for one of you the darkest pit of Hell has opened to swallow you whole so don't keep the devil waiting old friend

My daughter, if you can hear me, I knew you would return as well. It's in your nature to protect the innocent. I'm sorry that on that day, the day you were shut out and left to die, no one was there to lift you up into their arms the way you lifted others into yours, and then, what became of you. I should have known you wouldn't be content to disappear, not my daughter. I couldn't save you then, so let me save you now. It's time to rest - for you, and for those you have carried in your arms.

This ends for all of us.

End communication
